climbs.name: Pinkham's Magic
climbs.fa: John Halupowski, Laura Halupowski, and Ben Miller. 6/30/18

content.description: A great route. Start up the same face as Hop High to a ledge. Go right over a short steep wall, nice moves, on to the upper face. Continue up and right to a left-slanting crack. At the top of the crack exit left back on to the well featuredsteep face. When you reach the top block and small horizontal crack go right and up to the anchor. Great rock, moves, and pro.The Cure Var. 5.8 PG13   This variation to PM follows thinner climbing and pro. Climb Pinkham's Magic until the 5th bolt. Instead of going right to a crack, stay left of the bolt and up through thinner moves to rejoin TMOP at the 6th bolt.  At the top block go left to a steep beautiful crack finish.
content.protection: 8 Bolts, small and medium cams and wires
content.location: Left side of cliff. Same start as Hop High.

climbs.name: Hop High
climbs.fa: Ben Miller and John Halupowski. FA 7/16/18

content.description: Up the face 20' to a large ledge. Traverse left and pull the roof on good hands (good luck with your feet) and continue up the well featured face.
content.protection: Bolts and a small cam. 2 bolt rap/ring anchor
content.location: The left most climb on the face that passes over a 3' roof.

content.description: Good climbing. On the right side of the crag climb 20' up to the roof. Turn the roof on it's right side then up the face toward the juggy arete.
content.protection: Medium cams, stoppers, 4 bolts, 2 SS rap ring anchors.
content.location: Last climb on the right. 30' to the right of Pinkham's Magic.

content.description: This nice little crag is a quick 15 minute walk from the Wildcat Ski Area. You get a view of it from near the base lodge. The climbs are fun moderates on well featured rock, bolted where needed, and have SS rap/ring anchors.
